meta.title: Unix Timestamp Converter - Epoch Time Tool
meta.description: Free online Unix timestamp converter. Convert Unix timestamps to human-readable dates and vice versa. Supports both seconds and milliseconds.

tagline: Convert between Unix timestamps and human-readable dates instantly

description.title: What is Unix Timestamp Converter?
description.text: Unix Timestamp Converter is a developer tool designed to convert Unix timestamps (Epoch time) into human-readable date formats and vice versa. It supports both seconds and milliseconds precisions, making it essential for debugging, database management, and logging analysis.

howTo.title: How to Use Unix Timestamp Converter
steps: To convert a timestamp: Enter the numeric timestamp in the input field
To convert a date: Select or enter a date and time
Click the 'Convert' button to see the result
View the converted time in Local, GMT, and Relative formats

features.title: Key Features
list: ‚ö° Instant Conversion: Real-time timestamp and date conversion
üïí Dual Precision: Supports both seconds and milliseconds
üåç Timezone Aware: Displays both Local and GMT/UTC times
üìÖ Relative Time: Shows how long ago or in the future a date is
üîí Privacy Focused: No data is sent to any server

questions.a: A Unix timestamp represents the number of seconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970 (UTC), not counting leap seconds. It is widely used in computer systems to track time.
The Year 2038 problem refers to a potential issue where 32-bit systems will no longer be able to store Unix timestamps after January 19, 2038, as the value will overflow.
Yes, the tool converts timestamps to your browser's local time and also provides the GMT/UTC equivalent.
